meanings.definition: To study or learn a role in a play as a substitute for the regular performer.
meanings.sent1: She is understudying the lead role in the school play.
meanings.sent2: The actor is understudying the main character in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent3: The understudying student accidentally memorized all the lines of the main character.
meanings.sent4: Understudying the role, she discovered new depths to the character's motivations.
meanings.sent5: Understudying requires dedication and attention to detail.

meanings.definition: The act of studying or learning a role in a play as a substitute for the regular performer.
meanings.sent1: Her understudying of the role paid off when she had to step in last minute.
meanings.sent2: The understudying of the character's mannerisms was crucial for the substitute actor.
meanings.sent3: The understudying process turned into a fun challenge for the theater group.
meanings.sent4: His understudying of the role was like stepping into someone else's shoes.
meanings.sent5: The importance of understudying became evident during the unexpected absence of the lead actor.
